name: 'The Wake Up Call' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What time was shown on the screen when the episode began?
questions.explanation:
8:00 PM.

	The President was sitting at his desk in the Oval Office listening to Verdi's 'Otello'. He and Abbey were going to the opera the next night. CJ mentioned to the President that 'Otello' was the one where the guy kills his wife.

questions.text: "I really can't believe we still let him in the building." About whom was this statement made?
questions.explanation:
Lord John Marbury.

	Leo had just walked into CJ's office and saw Lord John on the couch. After he made that statement to CJ and Kate, Kate said, "Tell me about it."

questions.text: Who made the decision that the wake up call was going to be made by them to the President every morning?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	CJ told the President that she would be making the phone calls ever morning to wake him up and his MS wouldn't be a factor in the wake up calls.

questions.text: What was Asefi Hossein Kamel Bin Hamid's nickname at the White House?
questions.explanation:
Chet.

	CJ asked Kate if it was weird that they called a high ranking Iranian official Chet and Kate said it was better than calling him by his full name. Later, CJ found out that Chet's job used to belong to a man they nicknamed Phil.

questions.text: As a Valentine's Day gift, who did CJ assign to meet with Miss World?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	CJ didn't want to be bothered with meeting Miss World and talking to her so she gave the job to Toby since he had been working so hard on the constitution writing. When a reporter started asking questions about the President whereabouts the morning of the airplane shooting, Annabeth sent Gordon to talk to Miss World to distract him. In the end, CJ told Annabeth to give Gordon what he wanted for being such a good sport in hanging out with Miss World that day.

questions.text: Like the new name he gave Leo, did Lord John Marbury give CJ a new  name?
questions.explanation:
No.

	After CJ stopped Lord John from hollering "Gerald!" through the halls of the White House, he referred to her as "the new Gerald".

questions.text: What country's constitution was Professor Lessig helping to write?
questions.explanation:
Belarus.

	Christopher Lloyd played Professor Lawrence Lessig, a constitutional law professor that was going to help the Belarusians write a constitution at the White House. According to TV.com, Professor Lawrence Lessig is an actual constitutional law professor at Harvard.

questions.text: Who did the Leo say thought the President was a "Yankee Doodle windbag"?
questions.explanation:
Prime Minister Grady.

	The President was upset that CJ hadn't woken him up for the call with Prime Minister Graty, but Leo told him what Graty thought of him and said it might have made things worse if the President had been on the phone call with the Prime Minister.

questions.text: As Kate was leaving the Oval Office to speak to Abbey, what did Lord John call her?
questions.explanation:
Gentle courtesan.

	After Kate left the Oval Office, she asked Abbey if Lord John had just called her a. . . and before Kate could finish Abbey said, "Isn't he delightful." Webster's dictionary defines courtesan as a highly paid prostitute.

questions.text: Did the President and Abbey go to the opera on Valentine's Day?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Abbey called off the opera trip so the President could get some much needed rest. The President didn't like it, but Abbey said he had an early wake up call in the morning and hadn't had much sleep the night before.
